testcase.brief: Test marking, aerohive class0-7 mapping to dscp(0-63) Ethernet interface Test topology Top1 Device Configuration Ssid DeathKnight Interface wifi0 ssid DeathKnight qos marker-profile diff diffserv interface eth0 qos-marker diff qos marker-map diff 0-7 0-63
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: 1. create ssid ${ssid.name}, binding to wifi0; 2. set qos classifier-profile, and apply it on eth0 -v "qos marker-profile dscp diffserv" -v "interface eth0 qos-marker dscp" -v "qos marker-map 8021p [0-7] [0-63]"
Test Procedure: 1. sta1 connects to ssid ${ssid.name}, and obtained ip 2. sta1 ping master pc (as ping packet incoming from sta1, is classified on "def-ap-cls",in order to classifer the incoming ping packet to Aerohive qos class "x",so set with: -v "qos classifier-map service icmp qos [0-7]")
3. set debug filter -v "_ff id 1 src-ip sta1â€™s ip bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "_kdebug qos mark" 4. "show log buff" to check qos marker

step.desc: create a wpa_supplicant configuration file on Station
kill the wpa_supplicant on client side
start the wpa_supplicant on client side
config the laptop to apply the ssid profile,then start to associate
check if the client was associated successfully
get wireless IP from remote linux host sta1
get mpc IP from remote linux host mpc
set qos maker, and user it on eth0
step.telnet: -v "qos marker-profile dscp diffserv " -v "interface eth0 qos-marker dscp" -v "qos marker-map diff 2 48"

step.desc: show qos-classifer service, and check service icmp mapping to aerohive qos class 2
show qos-classifer service, and check service icmp mapping to aerohive qos class 2

step.telnet: -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${sta1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "_kdebug qos mark" -v "clear log buffered"

step.desc: Sta1 ping master pc to check qos marker
